ediT2-haskell

Safe HaskellSafe-Infered

Constraint.Checker

Description

Module to verify constraints on .t2 file.

Synopsis

  • run :: [String] -> IO ()
  • check :: NTree Cell -> [Cstr] -> String
  • checkConstraint :: NTree Cell -> Cstr -> Bool
  • match :: Identificator -> NTree Cell -> Bool

  • notContainedId :: Identificators -> NTree Cell -> Identificators
  • notContainedId' :: NTree Cell -> Identificators -> Identificators

  • containsId :: Identificators -> Identificators -> Int -> NTree Cell -> Bool
  • containsId' :: Identificators -> Int -> [NTree Cell] -> Bool
  • checkNotUnder' :: Identificators -> [NTree Cell] -> Bool
  • checkBefore :: Identificators -> [NTree Cell] -> Bool

Documentation

run :: [String] -> IO ()Source

run, entry point. Expect a file path for the output, the .t2 input file and a file containing constraints to check.

checkSource

Arguments

:: NTree Cell

The tree.

-> [Cstr]

Constraints to check.

-> String

Results.

check, check all the constraints.

checkConstraintSource

Arguments

:: NTree Cell

The tree.

-> Cstr

The constraint.

-> Bool

True, if the tree respects the constraint, False otherwise.

checkConstraint, check if the constaint is consistent with the tree.

matchSource

Arguments

:: Identificator

The identificator.

-> NTree Cell

The tree.

-> Bool

True, if the cell at the root of the tree matchs the identifcator. False, otherwise.

match, return True if the root cell matchs the identificator.

lookForSource

Arguments

:: NTree Cell

The tree.

-> (NTree Cell -> Bool)

Function determining if we must keep a subtree.

-> [NTree Cell]

Subtrees matched by the function.

lookFor, return trees with a root node matched by the function.

notContainedIdSource

Arguments

:: Identificators

Identificators.

-> NTree Cell

The tree.

-> Identificators

Identificators not matched.

notContainedId, return the list of identifcatos not matched in the tree.

notContainedId'Source

Arguments

:: NTree Cell

The tree.

-> Identificators

Identificators.

-> Identificators

Identificators not matched.

notContainedId', return the list of identifcatos not matched for the root node of the tree.

checkUnderSource

Arguments

:: Identificators

Identificators, matching items that must be in all subtrees.

-> [NTree Cell]

Subtrees.

-> Bool

True, if all the items matched by the identificators are in all the subtrees.

checkUnder, return True if all the items in the first list are in all subtrees selected.

checkUnder'Source

Arguments

:: Identificators

Identificators, matching items.

-> [NTree Cell]

Subtrees.

-> Bool

True, if all the items matched by the identificators are in a subtree or none of them. False, otherwise.

checkUnder', return True if all the items in the first list are in a subtree selected, or none of the items are in.

checkUnder1Source

Arguments

:: Identificators

Identificators, matching items.

-> [NTree Cell]

Subtrees.

-> Bool

True if at least one items in the first list is in the subtree (for each subtrees). False, otherwise.

checkUnder1, return True if at least one items in the first list is in the subtree (for each subtrees).

containsIdSource

Arguments

:: Identificators

Identificators.

-> Identificators

Identificators remaining to check for the root node.

-> Int

Number of matchs wanted.

-> NTree Cell

The tree.

-> Bool

True, if there is a number of matched wanted. False, otherwise.

containsId, check if a given number of identificators are matched.

containsId'Source

Arguments

:: Identificators

Identificators.

-> Int

Number of match.

-> [NTree Cell]

Subtrees.

-> Bool 

containsId', check if a given number of identificators are matched in at least one of the subtrees.

checkNotUnder'Source

Arguments

:: Identificators

Identificators, matching items.

-> [NTree Cell]

Subtrees.

-> Bool

True if only one items in the first list is in the subtree (for each subtrees). False, otherwise.

checkNotUnder', return True if only one item in the first list is in a subtree selected, or none of the items are in.

checkBeforeSource

Arguments

:: Identificators

Identificators.

-> [NTree Cell]

Subtrees.

-> Bool 

checkBefore, check if the first item is before the second item (with left right traversal on root nodes of trees).
